title: 'Ready for sacrifice': Trump tariff spike - No deal at farmers' cost, PM Modi says
content: "For us, the interest of our farmers is our top priority. India will never compromise on the interests of farmers, fishermen and dairy farmers," PM Modi said while speaking at the MS Swaminathan Centenary International Conference.

title: Trump asked why India singled out over Russian oil? His 'secondary sanctions' warning
content: Amidst deepening India-Russia oil ties, President Trump has escalated sanctions against New Delhi by imposing an additional 25% tariff, bringing the total to 50%. India's external affairs ministry swiftly condemned the increase as unfair and unreasonable, emphasizing that its oil imports are driven by energy security needs. Trump also hinted at potential secondary sanctions against China for similar actions.

title: 11 students hospitalised: To transfer Muslim principal, men poison school's water tank
content: In Karnataka, three men were arrested for poisoning a school water tank in Belagavi, hospitalizing 11 students. Sagar Patil, a Sri Ram Sene leader, masterminded the act targeting a minority headmaster, aiming for his transfer. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah condemned the incident as religiously motivated, blaming the BJP for fostering division.

title: UP encounter: Wanted mafia Ashish Ranjan gunned down near Prayagraj
content: Uttar Pradesh STF fatally shot Ashish Ranjan alias Chhotu Singh, a wanted mafia criminal from Dhanbad, Jharkhand, in an encounter near Prayagraj. Ashish, implicated in multiple high-profile murders, including gangster Aman Singh's, fired upon the STF team with an AK-47 and a 9mm pistol.

title: Deleting my Instagram today, writes tech startup CEO; Elon Musk responds
content: A tech startup CEO's decision to delete his Instagram account, declaring it's "time to be a man," has sparked widespread discussion. Elon Musk endorsed the move, echoing his criticism of Meta's platforms for superficial engagement and privacy concerns.

title: IPL: MS Dhoni teases fans about his CSK future - Will the legend return?
content: MS Dhoni has hinted at a continued association with Chennai Super Kings, suggesting he'll be linked with the franchise for the next 15-20 years. While his exact role remains uncertain, Dhoni assured fans he will be seen in the CSK yellow jersey. He expressed gratitude for the fans' support, highlighting the IPL as the next best thing to representing India.

title: Inside Mahua Moitra–Pinaki Misra wedding reception in Delhi
content: Top political figures convened in New Delhi for the wedding reception of TMC MP Mahua Moitra and former BJD MP Pinaki Misra, following their private German wedding. The event at Hotel Lalit saw prominent leaders like Sonia Gandhi, Akhilesh Yadav, and others offering their congratulations.

title: 'Only thing to stop US would be ... ': Trump's reciprocal tariffs take effect at midnight
content: President Trump announced new reciprocal tariffs effective at midnight, targeting countries allegedly exploiting the US. He claimed billions would flow into the US, attributing potential obstacles to a "radical left court."

title: Altman compares GPT-5 to the Manhattan project: Says 'I feel useless'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman voices concerns about GPT-5's capabilities, likening its development to the Manhattan Project. He admits feeling "useless" after witnessing its problem-solving abilities. The model's advancements raise fears about AI outpacing regulation and its potential for misuse, particularly in automated fraud, which is already a growing threat.

title: ‘Ganga at your doorstep to wash your feet’: UP minister’s flood remark draws flak
content: Uttar Pradesh Fisheries Minister Sanjay Nishad sparked controversy during a visit to flood-hit Kanpur Dehat by suggesting the Ganga's floodwaters were there to cleanse a woman's feet, offering a path to heaven. This remark drew criticism from opposition parties, who deemed it insensitive amidst the suffering of flood-affected residents.

title: Durand Cup | 'We're called Bangladeshi...' — EB fans deliver a stinging message
content: During a Durand Cup match, East Bengal fans protested against the branding of Bengali as a 'Bangladeshi language'. This followed West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's strong condemnation of Delhi Police for using the term in an official letter.

title: Dharmasthala mass burial probe: 4 YouTubers assaulted after clash with locals
content: In Dharmasthala, tensions flared as YouTubers covering the SIT exhumation in the alleged mass burials case were assaulted by locals, resulting in minor injuries. Police intervened with a mild lathicharge to control the situation. FIRs are being registered following complaints from YouTubers and a counter-complaint regarding an assault on a reporter.

title: Angry at Mira Murati for refusing Meta's Job Offer; Zuckerberg launched a full-scale …
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: 'So we ARE relevant?' South Park mocks White House after ICE uses cartoon to recruit
content: Tensions flared between the Trump administration and "South Park" creators after the DHS used imagery from the show for recruitment, prompting a sharp response from the program. The DHS defended its use, stating it aimed to attract patriotic Americans to help remove violent criminals.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Will yellow metal continue trading above Rs 1 lakh
content: Gold prices are exhibiting a strong bullish trend, potentially reaching ₹1,03,000, supported by global uncertainties. Silver has shown a bullish breakout, aiming for ₹1,17,000, driven by buying interest and overall positive sentiment in the metals market. Investors should monitor key support and resistance levels for both gold and silver to confirm continued momentum.

title: Asim Munir likely to visit US again: Pak army chief to meet Trump? 2nd trip expected in 2 months
content: Pakistan army chief Asim Munir, is likely to visit the US for the second time. He previously met President Donald Trump in Washington. This occurred amidst India-Pakistan tensions after the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. Trump claimed credit for a ceasefire and announced a trade deal with Pakistan. Simultaneously, US-India relations strained due to tariffs imposed on Indian goods.

title: 'Go back to India': 6-yr-old Indian-origin girl assaulted in Ireland
content: A six-year-old Indian-origin girl in Waterford City was racially abused and physically assaulted by a group of teenagers, prompting outrage. In a separate incident, Laxman Das, an Indian sous chef in Dublin, was attacked and robbed while going to work. These incidents follow a series of recent assaults targeting Indians in Ireland, raising concerns about racism.

title: Cloudburst: Local festival spares lives as half of residents travel across stream
content: A flash flood in Dharali devastated one side of the village, but many residents were spared due to their participation in the Hardoodh festival on the opposite bank. This annual ritual, dedicated to Naag Devta, drew them away from the vulnerable side of the stream, where unscientific construction had taken place.

title: Siraj is everything Bumrah isn't — Available, reliable, unbreakable
content: Mohammed Siraj emerged as a pivotal force for Team India, especially shining in the absence of key players like Bumrah. His remarkable performance in the England series, where he became the highest wicket-taker, showcased his leadership potential and ability to thrive under pressure.

title: Rajasthan horror: Over 25 dogs slaughtered as men on motorbikes shoot at strays in Jhunjhunu
content: A shocking incident in Jhunjhunu's Kumawas village has ignited fury among animal activists after a video surfaced showing two men shooting and killing over 25 dogs. The gruesome act, which occurred on August 2nd and 3rd, prompted police action after the video circulated on social media.

title: Cricket | Player who had beef with Virat Kohli to play in India - Details inside
content: Australian opener Sam Konstas, remembered for his on-field clash with Virat Kohli during the Border-Gavaskar series, is set to tour India next month with the Australia A squad. The 19-year-old, who debuted in the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne, will participate in four-day matches in Lucknow.

title: IND vs ENG: Has Karun Nair played his last Test?
content: Karun Nair's comeback to the Indian Test team in England saw him contribute a crucial half-century, but his overall returns of 205 runs at an average of 25.67 may not be enough to secure his place.

title: Stock market: Nifty opens below 24,550, Sensex slips 150 pts as Trump’s India tariff hits sentiment
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Thursday as US President Donald Trump’s move to double tariffs on India to 50% weighed on sentiment.

title: Thank God, I didn't face a 90mph bouncer one-handed: Chris Woakes
content: In a dramatic turn at The Oval, injured England all-rounder Chris Woakes displayed immense courage by batting with a dislocated shoulder during a tense chase against India. Despite being officially ruled out, Woakes walked in to a standing ovation with England needing 17 runs. Though he didn't face a ball, his presence inspired.

title: Made in US: A 24-k gold gift for Trump, a tariff relief for Apple - watch
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook gifted President Trump an American-made glass engraving, securing a significant advantage for Apple. Trump announced that companies like Apple, manufacturing in the US, would be exempt from upcoming tariffs on semiconductor imports. Apple also pledged an additional $100 billion investment in its US operations over the next four years.

title: Trump's 50% tariff: 'Crude bullying', says Congress; declares 'India shall overcome'
content: Congress MP Manish Tewari criticized the US' new tariff on India as "crude bullying," expressing confidence in India's resilience. This follows President Trump's imposition of a 25% tariff on Indian crude oil imports from Russia, bringing the total to 50%. Rahul Gandhi also alluded to Trump's remarks about India and Russia in Parliament.

title: 'Held back when team needed more': Ex-India pacer questions Bumrah’s impact in England
content: Irfan Pathan has critiqued Jasprit Bumrah's performance in the recent Test series against England, despite Bumrah being one of the top wicket-takers. Pathan believes Bumrah didn't display enough killer instinct in crucial moments, particularly when defending totals or needing breakthroughs. He highlighted instances where Bumrah could have bowled longer spells or varied his approach to create more pressure on the opposition.

title: Rishabh Pant pays Rs 40k college fee for girl from underprivileged family
content: Indian cricketer Rishabh Pant demonstrated his generosity by funding the Rs 40,000 college fees for Jyoti Kanabur, a student from Vijayapura. Jyoti's parents, who run a small eatery, struggled to afford her education despite her academic success. Pant's timely intervention relieved the family's financial burden, ensuring Jyoti could pursue her degree.

title: ‘I don’t know if they’re alive’: Man awaits news of 8 missing friends in Dharali
content: A devastating flash flood in Dharali, Uttarakhand, has left Amit Semwal in anguish, as his close friends are missing. Despite his desperate attempts to reach them, relentless rain and unstable terrain hinder his efforts. Amit recounts the horror of witnessing the disaster from nearby Mukhba, fearing the worst for his childhood friends who were building their lives in the village.

title: Cyber attack? United Airlines grounds hundreds of flights at US airports
content: United Airlines faced widespread disruptions Wednesday evening after a technology issue temporarily grounded all mainline flights. Hundreds of flights were delayed, and some were canceled, impacting passengers across the U.S. Key hubs like Newark, San Francisco, and Denver experienced ground stops. The airline confirmed the issue was not a cyberattack and that United Express flights were unaffected.

title: Dharali flash flood: 360 million cubic metres of glacial debris came tumbling down, experts estimate
content: A devastating flash flood in Dharali village was triggered by a massive collapse of glacial sedimentary deposits, not just heavy rain. Experts estimate an avalanche of 360 million cubic meters of debris flattened structures and claimed lives. The unstable glacial deposit, combined with steep terrain, accelerated the debris flow, leaving residents with no chance of escape.

title: Finland-based thinktank exposes US double standard
content: Data reveals the EU's significant role in Russia's fossil fuel revenues, surpassing India's contribution since the Ukraine conflict began. Despite Western sanctions, G7+ tankers transport over half of Russia's oil, highlighting a disconnect between policy and practice. While Russia's fossil fuel revenues have decreased, exports have increased, with India emphasizing its role in stabilizing global oil prices.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for August 7 - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha suggests a cautious outlook on Nifty and Bank Nifty, anticipating potential sharp moves. He recommends buying Asian Paints, Cummins India, and Eicher Motors.

title: 'Genuinely worried': Woakes reveals Gill’s comment after gutsy effort
content: England's Chris Woakes, battling a shoulder injury sustained on Day 1, displayed remarkable courage during the fifth Test against India. Despite the pain, he walked out to bat when England were nine wickets down, earning applause from the crowd and respect from the Indian team. Shubman Gill praised Woakes' bravery after the match.

title: IND vs ENG: Chris Woakes - 'You lose a player, you find a way'
content: Chris Woakes supports Ben Stokes' opposition to injury substitutions in Test cricket, citing potential loopholes despite understanding the appeal for freak injuries like his fractured shoulder. Woakes believes losing a player forces resilience and strengthens the team. He reflects on the public support following his decision to bat through the pain in the final Test.

title: Dementia: Neurosurgeon wants you to know about high BP, diabetes
content: Dr. Zayed Almadidy highlights five modifiable risk factors for dementia, including lack of physical activity, uncontrolled diabetes, high blood pressure, hearing loss, and tobacco and alcohol use. Addressing these factors through lifestyle changes and medical management can significantly reduce the risk of cognitive decline and Alzheimer's disease, promoting better brain health as people age.

title: Hulk Hogan snub claim: Brooke’s husband speaks out; says wrestling icon ignored grandkids
content: Hulk Hogan's relationship with his daughter Brooke was strained before his death, with her husband, Steven Oleksy, revealing Hogan showed no interest in meeting his newborn twins, despite Brooke's efforts to reconnect. The couple had moved to Florida to support Hogan, but he remained distant, leaving Brooke heartbroken by unanswered attempts to reconcile.

title: 'Ask me that when I retire': Travis bluntly shuts down retirement talk; fans react to his confidence
content: Kansas City Chiefs' tight end Travis Kelce, 35, dismisses retirement talks despite entering his 13th NFL season. Kelce's sharp response to retirement questions during training camp indicates his focus remains on football. Coach Andy Reid affirms Kelce's importance to the team, while teammate Patrick Mahomes highlights Kelce's improved physique and dedication.

title: Dwyane Wade’s scandal recall: Ex-wife's STD claim; 'The gossip went global,' NBA star says
content: Dwyane Wade's past divorce from Siohvaughn Funches resurfaced due to accusations of transmitting an STD, which he vehemently denied. Wade detailed the ordeal in his book, highlighting the defamation suit he filed and the subsequent withdrawal of claims. Despite the controversy and public scrutiny, Wade moved on, finding love with Gabrielle Union.

title: 'It's definitely a blow': Shashi Tharoor reacts to Trump's 50% tariff on India
content: Shashi Tharoor has criticised the US imposition of a 25% tariff on India's crude oil imports from Russia, bringing the total tariff on Indian goods to 50%. He warned that this will make Indian products less competitive in the US market compared to countries with lower tariffs. The ministry of external affairs also expressed its disapproval of the US decision.

title: PM Modi may visit China for the 1st time in 7 years; visit amid trade standoff with US
content: PM Narendra Modi is likely to visit China for the Shanghai Cooperation Summit in late August, hosted by President Xi Jinping. Preparations are underway for India's participation, with a potential bilateral meeting between Modi and Xi on the agenda.

title: 'Like Ashwin, Kuldeep must ...': Ex-player explains India's selection call in England
content: Robin Uthappa offered his perspective on Kuldeep Yadav's exclusion from the Test series against England, emphasizing team balance over pure bowling skill. He contrasted Kuldeep with Ravichandran Ashwin, highlighting Ashwin's batting prowess. Uthappa also lauded Yashasvi Jaiswal's dedication and Shubman Gill's evolving leadership, noting Gill's tactical growth during the series.

title: Blue Jays total 45 runs, 63 hits in sweep of Rox
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. had four hits, including a home run, and the Blue Jays finished off a three-game sweep of the Rockies in which they had 63 hits and scored 45 runs.

title: NFLPA gets clarity: Players' own smelling salts OK
content: The NFL clarified a memo sent to clubs on Tuesday, saying players will still be able to whiff smelling salts during games this season as long as the team doesn't provide them.

title: Red Sox sign rookie Anthony to 8-year extension
content: Rookie Roman Anthony has signed an eight-year extension with the Red Sox. The deal is worth $130 million and could escalate as high as $230 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Son signs deal, calls MLS move 'dream come true'
content: LAFC's blockbuster summer signing Son Heung-Min said his move to the MLS club is a "dream come true" after a 10-year run with Tottenham Hotspur.

title: Kittredge, booed a day ago, has immaculate inning
content: Less than a day after he was booed off the mound in a loss to the Reds, Cubs reliever Andrew Kittredge threw an immaculate inning Wednesday, Chicago's first since 2022.

title: Mboko rallies into Montreal final, will play Osaka
content: Canadian teenager Victoria Mboko beat ninth-seeded Elena Rybakina 1-6, 7-5, 7-6 (4) to advance to the National Bank Open final, where she will meet four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka.

title: Miami makes Leagues Cup quarters with Messi out
content: Inter Miami beat Pumas UNAM in their final group game of the 2025 Leagues Cup on Wednesday night at Chase Stadium to clinch a spot in the knockout round of the tournament.

title: Day: Ohio State QB battle to go 'down to the wire'
content: Ohio State's quarterback competition between Julian Sayin and Lincoln Kienholz remains too close to call, coach Ryan Day says.

title: Need an ace to win big? Even with deep pockets, Mets refuse to overpay
content: Whether it's in free agency or at the trade deadline, David Stearns isn't compromising on his starting pitching philosophy.

title: Can loading up on relievers at the deadline win you a World Series? We found out
content: Contenders went all-in for relievers at this year's deadline. Here's how much bullpens really help in October.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without stars.

title: Garrett Nussmeier's dad prepared him for the big moments. None will be bigger than 2025
content: The quarterback's dad is the offensive coordinator for the Saints. His mom is from Louisiana. Now, he has a shot to leave his stamp on the state.

title: Lakers' next era: Fits around Luka, LeBron's future, and why 2027 could change everything
content: The Lakers locked in Luka Doncic. Now what? NBA insiders examine the moves L.A. can and should make to build its next title team.

title: 'Steal reps' and 'losing ground': How the Browns are navigating a four-way QB competition
content: Amid an unusual preseason with four QBs vying for the top spot, Cleveland has distributed reps in unique ways.

title: What to watch over the next three weeks, including Ryder Cup spots
content: The playoffs start Thursday in Memphis with spots in the Tour Championship on the line. But that's not all that's at stake, with players jockeying for spots on the Ryder Cup teams.

title: Transgender athlete debate rolls on six months after executive order
content: Six months after President Trump signed an executive order banning trans women from women's sports, these athletes are still trying to find ways to compete, and battles around their participation continue.

title: Keith Tkachuk on Matthew, Brady, Olympic gold and his Hall of Fame snub
content: "There's nothing better than seeing your kids do what they love to do best," Tkachuk said of his All-Star sons.

title: Bridgewater talks coaching suspension at Bucs training camp
content: The new Tampa Bay quarterback talked publicly for the first time since his coaching suspension from his alma mater, Miami Northwestern High School.

title: 2025 SEC football preview: Power Rankings, top players, must-see games
content: Our college football experts breakdown preseason SEC Power Rankings, plus games and players to watch this fall.

title: NFL draft prospects with the most at stake this season: Who can make a statement in 2025?
content: Which players' draft stocks have the most riding on the 2025 college football season? We picked out 10, including three quarterbacks.

title: The legend Son Heung-Min is now headed to MLS, LAFC
content: In Son Heung-min, LAFC and MLS are getting an icon, legend and possibly the greatest Asian player of all time.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United tracking Fiorentina's Comuzzo
content: Fiorentina center back Pietro Comuzzo is being watched by Manchester United, Bournemouth and Sunderland. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Chris Boucher to the Celtics
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Looking for late-season heroes? Six players to target
content: A lot of teams made strong postseason pushes at the MLB trade deadline. What are you going to do with your team as the fantasy trade deadline approaches?

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: "Ready To Pay Personal Price": PM Modi's Strong Message Over Trump Tariffs
content: Sending a strong message the day after US President Donald Trump ratcheted up the tariff war against India, Prime Minister Narendra Modi stressed that India will never compromise with the interests of its animal husbandry industry and fishermen

title: Sensex, Nifty Decline In Early Trade As US Tariffs On Indian Goods Doubled
content: Benchmark equity indices Sensex and Nifty declined in early trade on Thursday as US President Donald Trump slapped an additional 25 per cent duty -- doubling it to 50 per cent -- on Indian goods over New Delhi's continued imports of Russian oil.

title: "Came For Faith, Leaving With Fear": 6 Die At Kubereshwar Dham Kanwar Yatra In Madhya Pradesh
content: All six victims had journeyed to Kubereshwar with unwavering devotion, only to lose their lives in the chaos that awaited them. Their bodies now lie in the district hospital mortuary.

title: 2025 Had Earth's Third-Hottest July On Earth: Scientists
content: Last month was Earth's third warmest July since records began and included a record national temperature in Turkey of 50.5 degrees Celsius (122.9 Fahrenheit), scientists said on Thursday.

title: Tata Consultancy Services Announces Wage Hikes Amid 12,000 Layoffs
content: India's largest IT services company Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) informed employees that it will roll-out wage hikes for about 80 per cent of workforce, covering mid to junior levels.

title: Yamuna River Crosses Warning Water Level In Delhi
content: The water level of the Yamuna river in Delhi reached 204.88 metres at the Old Railway Bridge here on Thursday, crossing the warning level of 204.50 metres, officials said.

title: Adani Power To Build $3 Billion Greenfield Thermal Plant In Bihar
content: Adani Power on Thursday said it has received a Letter of Intent (LoI) to develop and operate 2,400 MW greenfield thermal power plant in Bihar at an investment of $3 billion.

title: Who Is Edward Coristine? 19-Year-Old Being Praised By Trump And Musk
content: A former staff member of Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) is being widely praised for stopping a violent carjacking attempt in Washington, DC.

title: Apple To Expand US Manufacturing Base, To Use Only US-Made Rare Earth Magnets
content: Technology giant Apple has announced a major push to expand its manufacturing base in the United States, including a decision to exclusively use rare-earth magnets made in the country.

title: Trump India Tariffs 2025 Live Updates: Trump Warns Of Secondary Sanctions, India Reuses To Budge
content: US Trade Tariffs Live News Updates: US President Donald Trump has imposed steeper tariffs on Indian goods over New Delhi's continued purchase of Russian oil, opening a new front in his trade wars hours before another wave of duties takes effect.

title: Tariff Storm In Parliament Today? Rahul Gandhi Flags "Economic Blackmail"
content: US President Donald Trump's sweeping new tariff on India is likely to echo in Parliament on Thursday, with the Congress moving an adjournment motion for a discussion on the "unfair" imposition.

title: Trump Was Asked Why He's Singling Out India Over Russia Trade. His Reply
content: US President Donald Trump warned of new "secondary sanctions" for Moscow's trading partners when he was asked why India was being "singled out" for its business ties with Russia, leaving other nations that have been buying Russian energy.

title: "Punched, Hair Pulled": Racist Attack On Indian-Origin Girl, 6, In Ireland
content: A six-year-old Indian-origin girl is the latest victim of racist attacks in Ireland. Nia Naveen, whose family hails from Kottayam in Kerala, was playing outside her house in Waterford City in southeast Ireland when a gang of children attacked her.

title: Notification For Vice President's Election Issued, Nomination Process Begins
content: The Election Commission issued a notification on Thursday for the September 9 election to the office of the vice president, kickstarting the nomination process.

title: US In Race With China To Claim "Best" Part Of Moon: NASA Chief
content: The United States is in a new space race with China to claim the most resource-rich part of the moon, NASA's interim administrator Sean Duffy said while announcing plans to install a nuclear reactor on the lunar surface by 2030.

title: Devendra Fadnavis Orders Controlled Feeding Of Pigeons At 'Kabutarkhanas'
content: Though Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis now says the "abrupt" closure of pigeon feeding sites in Mumbai was not advisable and the BMC should ensure controlled feeding of the birds.

title: "Shouldn't India Seize This Chance For Itself?" Anand Mahindra On US Tariff
content: India must go beyond incremental reform to radically improve ease of doing business by seizing the opportunities created by "unintended consequences" of US President Donald Trump's tariffs, Anand Mahindra said

title: Pak Army Chief Set For US Trip, 2nd In 2 Months, Amid Trump's Tariff War
content: Pakistan Army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir is set to visit the US for the second time in two months, according to reports in the Pakistani media

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Watch: Influencer threatens air hostess after she catches him vaping in toilet
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . toi world Desk is a dedicated team of journalists and writers who work tirelessly to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world .

title: 📈 Yates' fantasy football PPR rankings
content: field Yates' 2025 fantasy football rankings will be updated throughout the preseason to reflect any changes in his view on players for the upcoming season . the rankings below are for PPR formats . he explains how Stefon Diggs could bounce back and put up big numbers in fantasy .

content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams . ari | ATL | BAL | BUF | CAR | CHI | CIN CLE | DAL | DEN | DET | GB | HOU | IND JAX | KC | LAC | LAR | LV | MIA | MIN NE | NO .

title: Top 'Drumbeat' players: Bo Nix, Omarion Hampton among those generating buzz
content: players below are just beginning to sing . the sounds are faint right now, but keep your ear to the ground . some of these players might be worthy of a league-winning ovation by season's end .

title: Ian Darke's 2025-26 Premier League preview: Chelsea to contend? Will Man United rebound?
content: Luis Garcia questions if Liverpool need to sign a striker after welcoming attacking additions to the club this summer . the premier league curtain is being raised in nine days' time, when the transfer window closes on sept. 1 . a year ago, who thought Liverpool would be champions, Manchester City would misfire and Tottenham Hotspur would finish 15th and 17th respectively?

title: 'Scottie's Chicken Shack' debuts at FedEx Cup
content: "Scottie's Chicken Shack" is a nod to the four-time major winner's role in "Happy Gilmore 2" the movie is released on Netflix on July 25 . the film is based on Scheffler's real-life arrest by the Louisville Metro police .

title: 20 sophomore NFL defenders who could stand out this season
content: twenty-seven rookies played at least 500 snaps on defense in 2024, a whopping 20 were defensive backs . a 500-snap threshold doesn't catch key players who sat out time or are expecting big roles this season . the defense's predraft reputation as a weaker group set a record .

title: WNBA's CBA negotiations: Why revenue sharing is priority No. 1 and whether a lockout is realistic
content: a meeting with commissioner Cathy Engelbert and ownership representative in Indianapolis is "a missed opportunity" players wore "Pay Us What You Owe Us" T-shirts during warmups . the move got some criticism, too . retired WNBA legend Candace Parker said it wasn't a great look for the plaza .

title: Explaining MLS' discovery rights: What were Müller's extra steps to Vancouver?
content: MLS commissioner don Garber speaks about the potential change to the league's schedule after the 2026 FIFA World Cup . atypical but significant mechanism in MLS's single-entity structure called the Discovery List . the regulation allows teams to "discover" and select up to five non-MLS players .

title: Kerala State Electricity Board gets regulatory commission’s approval for four battery energy storage systems at substations
content: BESS units planned at sub-stations at Sreekantapuram in Alappuzha, Pothencode in Thiruvananthapuram, Mulleria in Kasaragod and Areacode in Malappuram to handle large volume of surplus solar power being generated

title: GST fraud: ED raids in West Bengal, Maharashtra and Jharkhand
content: At least a dozen premises in the three States were raided under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, sources said.

title: Infosys sets up Centre for Advance AI in Hubballi
content: Minister for Rural Development and Panchayat Raj and IT, BT Priyank Kharge has said that as state government was promoting innovations and new innovations were happening in Hubballi, Dharwad, Belagavi along with other centres in the state.

title: Bengal’s college teachers’ union, once led by luminaries including S. Radhakrishnan, turning 100
content: West Bengal College and University Teachers’ Association which began its centenary celebrations on August 3, will continue holding events throughout the year.

title: Toxic blaze triggers night-long explosions at cold storage facility in Sangareddy
content: Stored hazardous chemicals caused repeated explosions throughout the night. As the fire reacted with volatile substances, firefighters were forced to pause operations multiple times for safety.

title: Ready to pay personal price to protect farmers' interest: PM Modi on Trump tariff
content: His remarks come against the backdrop of the U.S. announcing a further increase in the tariff on Indian goods, including agricultural products, to 50%.

title: Amartya Sen on SIR: ‘There should not be targeted attempt to eliminate voice of some citizens, especially from deprived parts of India’
content: Economist Amartya Sen speaks with The Hindu on the Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls in Bihar and other parts of India

title: Prime accused in Tiruppur SSI murder case shot dead by police in ‘self-defence’
content: Police sources said the accused, Manikandan, was shot near Upparu stream near Chikkanur by the SI Saravanakumar in “self-defence”

title: India's E20 petrol rollout sparks driver revolt
content: The government's fast-expanding ethanol programme aims to cut costly oil imports by blending petrol with ethanol

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 14 LIVE: Lok Sabha to take up Manipur GST ordinance, Anti-Doping law amendments
content: Lok Sabha passed the Merchant Shipping Bill, 2024, and Rajya Sabha passed the Carriage of Goods by Sea Bill, 2025 on Wednesday

title: Uttarkashi flash floods rescue operation LIVE: 190 people rescued, dozens remain missing from the site
content: Helicopter operations begin to evacuate stranded pilgrims from Gangotri Dham after Uttarkashi cloudburst

title: Analysis of Bihar SIR electoral rolls hints at higher voter deletions in Muslim-majority districts
content: Preliminary analysis hints at higher voter deletions in Muslim-majority districts and possibly high out-migration areas

title: 16 persons missing from Maharashtra's Jalgaon after cloudburst in Uttarkashi
content: Around 190 people have been rescued from Dharali following a devastating cloudburst that triggered massive flash floods and landslides in the area

title: Notification for Vice-President's election issued; nomination process begins
content: According to the notification, August 21 is the last date for filing nominations, while the documents will be scrutinised on August 22; Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post as Vice President on July 21

title: Bombay HC’s larger Bench to settle if caste scrutiny committees have power to recall orders based on fraud
content: Additional Government pleaders S.P. Sonpawale and Saie S. Joshi argued that scrutiny committees must retain the power to recall certificates obtained by fraud, even if such power is not expressly provided in the 2000 Act.

title: Cabinet approves new LIFT policy to attract top-tier IT/ITeS firms, GCCs
content: The Cabinet approved the new LIFT Policy 4.0 (2024–29), offering land at a nominal rate of ₹0.99 per acre to attract top-tier IT/ITeS firms, GCCs, and developers.

title: ‘It’s like writing a poem’: prize winner Rajula Srivastava on doing maths
content: Rajula Srivastava won the Maryam Mirzakhani New Frontiers Prize, an initiative of the Breakthrough Prize in Mathematics, in 2025 for her work in harmonic analysis and analytic number theory

title: R.G. Kar victim’s family to meet CBI Director, Home Minister
content: The visit by parents of the R.G. Kar victim to the national capital assumes significance as it comes ahead of August 9 march to Kalighat

title: U.P. Minister scolds PWD engineer for opening bridge without approval
content: The incident is latest of many instances in which U.P. Ministers come face-to-face with officials over violation of protocol and arbitrary actions

title: Groups of Ministers from Andhra to be sent on study tours to developed countries
content: The idea is to study the development projects there and bring innovative policies to the State, says the Chief Minister

title: Chhattisgarh High Court acquits man convicted for murdering kin on grounds of ‘legal insanity’
content: The HC held that an accused who seeks exoneration from liability of an act under Section 84 has to prove legal insanity and not medical insanity

title: Trump non-committal on whether extra India tariffs will go with Russia-Ukraine ceasefire
content: After imposing additional tariffs on India for trading in arms and energy with Russia, U.S. President Donald Trump said other countries could follow suit, suggesting China by name as a possibility

title: Brinda Karat voices concern against Chhattisgarh’s approval for mining in Hasdeo region
content: The CPI(M) leader says there is no public interest involved in the project, and it will only lead to the exploitation of mineral resources for private gain

title: Leaders hail work of visionary scientist M.S. Swaminathan
content: In a panel discussion that followed the book release, Shashi Tharoor, said Dr. Swaminathan worked at a time when the memories of Bengal famine were haunting the country.

title: Bars in Andhra Pradesh allowed to operate until 11 p.m. as Cabinet approves new policy
content: Permits rooms allowed; new policy proposes a shift from auction system to lottery-based allocation; 10% of bar licences reserved for toddy tappers

title: Indofast Energy sets up 80 EV battery swap stations in two divisions of SCR, plans 40 more
content: Of the 80, Secunderabad division hosts 56 facilities, while the remaining are under Hyderabad division

title: ‘Digital threads’ tighten grip in Hyderabad as bazaars see dip in Rakhi sales
content: Demand surges across quick-commerce apps; footfall thins in traditional hotspots of Hyderabad, such as Begum Bazaar and Sultan Bazaar, which still brim with stalls of rakhi threads, decorative platters and gift boxes

title: Telangana to celebrate textile heritage, honour weavers on National Handloom Day on August 7
content: Sri Konda Laxman Bapuji Awards to be presented to selected weavers and designers; handloom exhibitions, public meetings with weaving communities and district-level programmes also planned

title: NHRC issues show-cause notice over stampede death at Pushpa 2 screening
content: Asks why it should not recommend a compensation of ₹5 lakh to the next of kin of woman who died in the December 4 stampede

title: Donald Trump from Samastipur: fake application rejected in Bihar
content: District administration lodges FIR, warns that any kind of deliberate wrong information or fraud can lead to application rejection as well as criminal prosecution

title: Karnataka police hat to get replaced
content: While officers above the sub-inspector rank wear khaki peaked hats, for head constables and constables, the department chose a different colour with minor changes in the design

title: Hasdeo mining issue resurfaces in Chhattisgarh with ‘clearance’ for another project
content: The project potentially paves the way for the felling of 4.5 lakh trees, drawing criticism from Opposition parties and environmentalists

title: A.G. Noorani, Arundhati Roy’s books among 25 ‘forfeited’ by J&K Home Department
content: The department said these books deeply impact the psyche of youth by promoting a culture of grievance, victimhood and terrorist-heroism

title: Petrol lobbies behind E20 fuel fear campaign: Nitin Gadkari
content: Speaking at The Hindu’s Mind series, the Union Minister blames “political conspiracy” for social media outrage over shift to E20 and an expected surge in maintenance costs, while petrol prices remain unchanged

title: Mohan Majhi government prescribes new colour, closely resembling saffron, for government buildings in Odisha
content: Principal opposition party Biju Janata Dal slams the decision, says it is an attempt to distract attention from failures

title: Over 100 names ‘missing’ from electoral rolls in Bihar’s Jehanabad
content: Residents, mostly from marginalised communities, claim deletion; officials assure rectification via Form 6

title: JNCASR research holds promise for curing Alzheimer’s Disease
content: This research involves novel therapeutic target and treatment options based on RNA and small molecules, which could potentially accelerate the drug discovery process

title: East Asia to be next focus of India’s major diplomatic outreach
content: The visit to Japan is significant as both countries are part of the Quad initiative that was launched by Australia, India, Japan and the United States in 2017

title: Woman gang-raped in M.P., four held
content: Police said the incident took place on August 5 afternoon when the woman and her friend visited a forested area; State Congress president slammed the government over “horror of cases of Dalit, tribal, and women’s oppression”

title: Supreme Court directs liquidation of regulatory assets owed to discoms over a four-year period
content: The judgment directed the State Regulatory Commissions to provide the trajectory and roadmap for liquidation of the existing regulatory assets

title: If Telangana’s BC reservation Bills don’t get approval, BJP will be proven anti-OBC: Revanth Reddy
content: He leads sit-in protest demanding the President’s consent for two Bills passed by the State Assembly that seek 42% reservations to Backward Classes in local body elections as well as in education and employment sectors

title: Refer sports Bills to Joint Parliamentary Committee: Opposition urges Lok Sabha Speaker
content: In a letter to the Speaker, the leaders said the Bills require more discussion “in view of their national importance, the need for broad consensus, and the value of consulting relevant stakeholders”

title: Tensions erupt at Dadar’s Kabutarkhana over BMC action on pigeon feeding site
content: Protesters dismantle tarpaulin erected as per Bombay HC order; Minister Lodha condemns incident, urges restraint

title: Charred body of 20-year-old college girl found at her home in Odisha
content: Parents have alleged that their daughter was dissuaded from filing a police complaint against the person who was accused of blackmailing her

title: Trump’s imposition of 50% tariff is economic blackmail to secure unfair trade deal: Rahul Gandhi
content: Soon after Donald Trump announced a penalty of another 25% on India for buying Russian oil, Rahul Gandhi said Prime Minister Narendra Modi should not let Indian interests be overridden

title: ED register case against Ferns Estates and Developers under FEMA
content: Investigation revealed that Errol Fernandes and his family members sent remittances to the tune of ₹20.5 crore abroad, according to the ED

title: EC bonded labour of BJP, won’t allow any action against State govt. officers: Mamata
content: On August 5, the EC had sent a letter to the State Chief Secretary informing about the suspension of four government officials of the State for irregularities in the registration of names in the voter list

title: ‘No ground’ for case against Adoor, Kerala Police get legal opinion
content: However, several activists have signalled that they will move criminal miscellaneous petitions in  magistrate’s court demanding his prosecution.

title: SFI wins Kannur University union polls for 26th year in a row
content: SFI accuses rivals of rigging and illegal entry; KSU–MSF blames SFI for abducting a university union councillor

title: MP appeals to MEA for repatriation of stranded Kakinada fishermen
content: The group of fishermen were caught by Sri Lanka on August 4 after they entered into Sri Lankan waters on their boat.

title: Pinarayi Vijayan to hand over keys to 332 flats constructed for fisherfolk at Muttathara on August 7
content: The flats are part of the first phase of a 400-flat housing complex envisaged to rehabilitate fisherfolk displaced by recurring sea surges and erosion

title: Supreme Court begins hearing pleas of women Army officers denied permanent commissions
content: Women officers with short service commissions blame “systematic discrimination” in annual confidential reports and denial of equal opportunities, resulting in denial of permanent commissions

title: Woman drives her dream with KSRTC at Ponnani
content: Arya Nanda credits the KSRTC for opening the driving school’s doors to women, paving the way for a new generation of female drivers

title: Kalyana Karnataka Horata Samiti to present memorandum to Govind Rao Committee
content: The memorandum contains various aspects for consideration and inclusion in a report to be submitted by the Govind Rao Committee

title: Fishing gear a major source of ‘microplastic’ contamination along Indian coasts
content: Minister Jitendra Singh shares findings from surveys conducted by Ministry of Earth Sciences through  the National Centre for Coastal Research

title: Injured worker dies weeks after Gujarat bridge collapse, toll now 22
content: Following the tragedy, four engineers from the State’s Roads and Buildings Department were suspended for alleged negligence
